events.description: The Dow Jones Industrial Average closed at a fresh historic high on Friday.
US equities staged a recovery following a tech-led selloff earlier in the week.

facts.fact_text: The Dow closed at a record high on Friday, surging 2.5%.

evidences.evidence_text: The Dow closed at a record high on Friday, surging 2.5%

facts.fact_text: Nvidia, Broadcom, and AMD surged over 7% each.

evidences.evidence_text: Nvidia, Broadcom, and AMD surging over 7% each

facts.fact_text: Amazon reaffirmed plans for $200 billion in AI investment.

evidences.evidence_text: Amazon extending losses by 5.6% after reaffirming plans for $200 billion in AI investment

facts.fact_text: The Nasdaq ended the week down 1.9%.

evidences.evidence_text: the Nasdaq still ended the week down 1.9%

claims.claim_text: Dip buying returned as fears around near term AI disruption and forced deleveraging eased.

evidences.evidence_text: dip buying returning as fears around near term AI disruption and forced deleveraging eased

claims.claim_text: The Nasdaq's weekly decline reflects lingering caution around elevated valuations and earnings execution risk.

evidences.evidence_text: reflecting lingering caution around elevated valuations, heavy AI capex commitments, and earnings execution risk

claims.claim_text: Outperformance in cyclicals reinforces a rotation toward value and economically sensitive sectors.

evidences.evidence_text: reinforcing a rotation toward value and economically sensitive sectors

evidence.evidence_text: fears around near term AI disruption and forced deleveraging eased
reinforcing a rotation toward value and economically sensitive sectors
Amazon extending losses by 5.6% after reaffirming plans for $200 billion in AI investment
